aboutMe: Passionate about software. Specifically, distributed systems and machine learning. Always eager to learn new things and I love problem solving. I find myself spending free time learning how to apply new concepts, whether it's new design patterns (Been on a Clean Code kick as of late!), or popular algorithms. I love to approach problems, data first. My favorite form of learning comes in form of complex problems, whether that be exploring interesting algorithms, or architecting something to deploy well at scale with maintainability in mind.

work.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
work.description: Leading backend architecture and machine learning initiatives. Built scalable ML systems for customer classification, real-time CRM integration platforms in Go, and modernized legacy reporting systems using AI-assisted reverse engineering and BigQuery. Driving ML adoption through mentorship and cross-team collaboration while contributing to system architecture discussions.

work.title: CDP Software Engineer
work.description: The tech used in this role varied on the daily functions. This team was a heavy focus on greenfield applications centered around combining data sources for aggregation based on business logic (and data models from our coordinating data science teams) to display for our salespeople. As of late, I jump between designing microservices, leading integrations for 4D, and building ML models to improve our systems.

work.title: CRM Software Engineer
work.description: The tech used in this role consisted of primarily 4D, a legacy proprietary language. My role was targeted towards the internal CRM that our company built out for handling customers and invoices/quotes. I worked on new features for handling duplicate logic, commissions, shipping UX, and more. I also tackled our software used by our diner on campus.

work.title: End User Operations
work.description: In this role, I focused primarily on helping end users debug application issues, troubleshoot hardware, remotely assist users, and manage basic help desk tickets. I also built out a web app for fairly distributing shipping workloads across main campuses during covid time -- it gave a good introductory into applied graph theory.

projects.title: Paper Prayer
projects.description: Created an app that leverages agentic workflows, semantic search, RAG, and information extraction to streamline the process of managing a bible study group. Built with Python, PostgreSQL with PGVector, React, and Flutter for cross-platform support.

projects.title: Real-time CRM Integration Platform
projects.description: Architected and delivered a real-time CRM integration platform to drive adoption of customer data platform. Built a scalable Go backend generating dynamic, config-driven customer lists and actions, enabling frictionless expansion and seamless integration into existing CRM workflows.

projects.title: Multi-label Customer Classification ML System
projects.description: Replaced rule-based customer classification with a scalable multi-label ML system trained on historical data, boosting customer coverage by 10%. Engineered a high-performance real-time batching architecture to serve hundreds of classification requests per second on a low compute footprint.

projects.title: Legacy CRM Reporting System Modernization
projects.description: Replaced a legacy CRM reporting system under C-suite direction, using AI-assisted reverse engineering to rebuild logic in BigQuery. Implemented atomic Redis caching in Go for O(1) lookups, and cut refresh time from multi-day runs to 30-minute intervals while improving flexibility and accuracy.

projects.title: Flexible Analytics System
projects.description: Developed a flexible analytics system used across internal applications, supporting scalable attribute extension and powering downstream data-science workflows. Enabled unified reporting and actionable insights.

projects.title: Matchmaking Backend
projects.description: This project consisted of building out pipelines and testing different algorithms in Golang using business logic, and building out a recommendation model in Python using SciKit Learn KNN and SVD. The end goal was to best recommend a salesperson to a customer based on their previous interactions with our company.

projects.title: Matchmaking Integration
projects.description: Architected and led a team of developers on integrating an external service to pair thousands of customers daily to a thousand salespeople using an asynchronous design pattern.

projects.title: Rule-engine deterministic Classifieds
projects.description: This project was a multi-team project in consuming data incoming from web and 4D via microservices, a custom built rule engine, integration into 4D, and lots of data validation. The end goal was to be able to predict a given category that a customer may fall under.

projects.title: Bible Modeling
projects.description: This project consists of building a few modeling techniques using NLP to perform semantic search given any topic or prayer request in the Bible. The thought behind this was to enable linking of prayer requests to verses (or sections) during a bible study. In future iterations, I hope to add sentiment analysis as well.

projects.title: Sweetwater Duplicate Logic
projects.description: This project was a multi-piece project in gearing our custom CRM to apply modern principles in dupe detection. It was a mix of a local weighted deterministic model with a high emphasis on performance, paired with an asynchronous call to our data science teamâ€™s model used for deeper predictions.

projects.title: Grocery App
projects.description: This project was built because I was tired of Kroger's grocery list not being realtime updates for when my wife and I go grocery shopping together. Using Kroger's API (which includes aisle information), I built an interface and backend/db for managing grocery lists, tracking shopping patterns, and a basic integrated chat platform

projects.title: Budgeting App
projects.description: This project was built for managing finances. From the apps I did use, i was disappointed with the lack of graphing functionality. So, I built a budgeting app to track budgeting reminders, extensively customizable graphing, IoT support for our raspberry pi with a 'display mode', and envelope-style budgeting

projects.title: Google Foobar Challenge
projects.description: Worked on the Google Foobar challenge on random invite from Google. It was a really fun time to dive deep into random algorithms and be tested on unknown test cases! I got through halfway round 4, mostly because I started the challenge and didn't have as much time as I thought I would. All in all, learned a lot, and it was a great way to challenge myself with time constraints.

projects.title: Leetcode
projects.description: I enjoy challenging myself to tougher problems on Leetcode. I have a couple accounts, and participate on them as I have time to regularly challenge my problem-solving skills.

projects.title: Datascience
projects.description: This has been an ongoing side project for quite some time. Even before the big boom of ChatGPT, I have been interested in ML, NLP, and image processing. It's been my goal to understand the underlying math, and not just how to use the packages like Pandas/Numpy/Scikit learn (Although I am trying to learn the packages too!). This has kicked off much re-learning math principles, watching videos from Stanform on youtube, researching articles, and utilizing content online from Google, Kaggle, Coursera, and Pluralsight.

projects.title: Typescript Code Challenge
projects.description: This internal website was built to get group-wide interaction and competitiveness for doing leet-code like problems and comparing performance against other developers. It also opened up sem-regular meetings to discuss code choices on different problems.

projects.title: Sweetwater Commissions
projects.description: Refactored, debugged, and enhanced commission workflows for our salespeople.

projects.title: Sweetwater Diner
projects.description: Maintained, scaled, and improved performance of legacy code to meet customer expectations, and to perform in such a way that allows for ease of use for customer. Enhanced communication with POS device for speed improvements, as well as improved logging of data.

projects.title: Shipping Calculator
projects.description: As part of a team of 3, we integrated a solution for refactoring how we calculated shipping internally, along with assisting a better asynchronous UI for a better UX.
